brief.brief: To change a field type from one scalar type to another (any type except an array or structure), requires the conversion of the data in that field to be consistent with the new type after the dbdict record has been appropriately modified.
To do this, use the mass update function in the Database Manager.

In this example, field is the name of the field whose type you changed and n = the number of the new data type.
Making a number from a string of characters that contain letters is invalid. If Service Manager cannot convert the data in the table to the new type, it issues an error message after the attempt.
